credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Organ
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
description: Vertical rectangle. Belonging to -1354. The canopy is supported by two posts at the front, dividing the wider central part from the lateral ones. They are mostly covered by a cloth. At right a flying angel is lifting a curtain, whereas at left a cherub is outside, corresponding with the head of the post. On top of the canopy is a sitting angel. In the central part, above, hangs a festoon. In front of the pipes are two crossed branches in each compartment. Written in the upper right corner: "82".
name: Drawing
